trans-unit.source: Provides an editor control that enables end users to edit several user interface (UI) properties on an associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> class is an editor control that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> class, and is used to edit properties that affect the appearance of an associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> or other server control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control enables end users to edit several UI properties of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control.
The type of control that appears in the page to edit each property value is listed in the adjacent cell of the following table.
Property
Control used to edit property
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control is used to set the text for the title.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control is used to select what type of title-and-border option is used.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control is used to select the direction that content flows on the page.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control is used to set a number for the height, and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control is used to select the units.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control is used to set a number for the height, and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control is used to select the units.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is used to indicate whether the control is hidden.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control becomes visible only when a Web Parts page is in edit mode, and when a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control has been selected for editing.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control, like all other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls, resides in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> zone.

An <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> zone can contain only <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls cannot be placed in any other type of zone.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> class has a minimal set of properties.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.Title%2A> property is used to get or set a string that is displayed as a title when the control is visible.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.DefaultButton%2A> property sets the inherited property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control, so that the default control that receives the focus within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control is the same as the default in the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> class also has two important methods.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.SyncChanges%2A> method overrides the base method from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> class.

This method is critical because it enables getting the property values from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control it is editing and assigning them to the fields in the editor control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.ApplyChanges%2A> method is also important, because it takes the values set by the user in the editing controls, and updates those property values on the control being edited.

In most cases the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control should be used in page persistence format by declaring an `<asp:appearanceditorpart>` element inside a `<zonetemplate>` element, which is in turn contained by an `<asp:editorzone>` element on a Web page.

To edit other properties and behavior of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, you can use the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls supplied with the Web Parts control set.

These controls include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.BehaviorEditorPart>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.LayoutEditorPart>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart>.

The supplied <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls should provide most editing features required to edit <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, but you can also create a custom editor control by inheriting from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> class.
For a code example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> class overview topic.
To improve accessibility, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control is rendered within a `<fieldset>` element.

The `<fieldset>` element groups the related set of controls used for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control, and it facilitates tabbed navigation among those controls for both visual (such as ordinary Web browsers) and speech-oriented user agents (such as screen-reading software).
Accessibility
The markup rendered by default for this control might not conform to accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines.
For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart"></xref> class.

Saves the values from an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart"></xref> control to the corresponding properties in the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.ApplyChanges%2A> method is a critical method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control.
It is called when the user clicks a button representing an OK or an apply verb in the editing user interface (UI).

The method's purpose is to save the values a user has set on an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control to the corresponding properties in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control.
The associated control is referenced in the inherited <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart.WebPartToEdit%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.ApplyChanges%2A> method attempts to set the following properties on the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control:

`true` if the action of saving values from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart"></xref> control to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control is successful; otherwise (if an error occurs), `false`.
An error occurs when setting the value for any of the following properties on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control that is being edited:
Overrides the base property inherited from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control to hide the property from designers and prevent it from being affected by themes.
Though it is public, this property is used for default rendering of this control and is not intended to be called from developer code.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
A string that contains the ID of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button"></xref> control that receives the default focus in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.

Retrieves the property values from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control and assigns them to the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.SyncChanges%2A> method is a critical method on an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control.

It implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart.SyncChanges%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method from the base class, retrieves the current values from the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control, and updates the controls in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control with those values so a user can edit them.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.SyncChanges%2A> method is called whenever the values in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control might have changed.

For an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZoneBase> zone that contains the control calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.SyncChanges%2A> method, so that the values in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control are always synchronized with the values in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control.

Another case where the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.SyncChanges%2A> method is called is when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control is entering edit mode.
Gets or sets a title for the editor control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart.Title%2A> property value is displayed in the title bar of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.AppearanceEditorPart> control when the control is visible in edit mode.
When the control is declared in a page, you can set a value for the `Title` attribute.
If you do not supply a value for the title, a culture-specific default value is used to describe the kinds of properties that this control allows users to edit.
A string that is used as the title of the control.
The default value is a calculated control name supplied by the Web Parts control set.
